segments.text: Excuse me , could you help me ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , what seems to be the problem ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well . I was wondering if anyone has turned in a passport ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I am afraid not . Have you lost your passport ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think so . I can't find it anywhere in my hotel room and I remember the last place I used it yesterday was in this department store .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Where exactly did you use your passport in the store ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: In the shoe department . I had to show it to pay for these shoes with my traveler's cheques .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , let me call the shoe department to see if they â€™ Ve found a passport . Sorry , your passport hasn't turned up there either .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You can fill in this lost property report and I will keep my eye out for it . These kinds of things usually turn up eventually , but I suggest you contact your embassy and tell them about your situation , so they can issue you a new passport in case it doesn't show up .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You are right . Do you have a pen ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , I seem to lose something every time I travel .
segments.speaker: S1
